description:
Mecklenburg County has multiple years of imagery available in Geo TIFF or Geo JPEG file formats. To request an imagery dataset, please use the BYO Drive form. The REST icon provides access to aerial REST services from 2018 to current imagery.

SID or ECW imagery, with same resolution as Geo Tiles, are available for download at the link below.
size: See BYO Drive form for Geo Tile size
title: Mecklenburg County Imagery

description:
Datasets generated from LiDAR are available at the link below. Data generated from LiDAR include: DEM, Aspect, Hillshade, Slope, and Topography.

LiDAR data are processed to a geographic extent: Southern Piedmont Region of Mecklenburg County, North Carolina, covering approximately 564 square miles.
size: See BYO Drive form for Geo Tile size
title: Mecklenburg County LiDAR

description: Mecklenburg County GIS has conducted tree canopy studies using NIR or False Color IR. Only trees are classified in these studies. Each tree canopy dataset was subject to a thorough manual quality control. All tree canopy analyses are conducted using unsupervised classifications and training areas in ArcGIS Pro.
title: Tree Canopy Analysis

description: Streams in Mecklenburg County identified in the Adopt-A-Stream Program. Citizen groups can adopt a one-mile stream segment for clean up purposes.
title: Adopted Streams

description: Charlotte-Douglas International Airport runways and terminal.
title: Airport

description: ABC (Alcohol Beverage Control) store locations in Mecklenburg County.
source: Mecklenburg County Alcohol Beverage Control Board
title: Alcohol Beverage Control Stores

description: Dataset denotes historical annexation boundaries for Charlotte, Davidson, Cornelius, Huntersville, Matthews, Mint Hill, and Pineville. This layer delineates a boundary for each annexation by year.
title: Annexation History

description: Dataset displays art exhibits. Like sculptures, murals, paintings, photography, lighting, and other mediums across the Charlotte area in Mecklenburg County. Art is both interior to buildings and exterior in public spaces.
title: ASC Art Installations

description: Data set is Bicycle Lanes for the City of Charlotte.
title: Bike Lanes

description: Data set is Signed Bicycle Routes for the City of Charlotte.
title: Signed Bike Routes

description: This dataset suggest bike routes to help cyclists navigate Charlotte's street network. The suggested routes have been identified with the assistance of the Bicycle Advisory Committe and experienced Charlotte cyclists.
title: Suggested Bike Routes

description: This dataset contains individual BMP areas associated with a property. Data includes inspection information and physical characteristics of the individual BMP in Mecklenburg County.
title: BMP Facility

description: This dataset contains project areas associated with individual BMP facilities. BMP projects contain BMP facilities, BMP facilities treat the run-off for a BMP project. General owner information is contained in this dataset contained in Mecklenburg County.
title: BMP Project

description: The nine-member Board of County Commissioners is the governing body of Mecklenburg County. Elections are held in November of even-numbered years with six commissioners elected by district and three commissioners elected at-large.
title: Mecklenburg County Commissioner Districts

description: This dataset contains building permits for structures in Mecklenburg County.
title: Building Permits

description:
This dataset contains building outlines for structures in Mecklenburg County.

Historical data is available at the link below.
title: Building Footprints

description: This dataset displays areas that are within a 1/4 mile of a commercial property that has a value 70% the County average and a median household income of <= 55K in Mecklenburg County.
title: Business Investment Opportunity Zones

description: The Carolina Thread Trail (The Thread) is a regional network of planned greenways and trails totaling 1,400 miles that reaches 15 counties and 2.3 million people. This shapefile shows the location of adopted Thread Trail routes which were decided upon by the individual counties. Thread Trail routes can include natural surface trails, paved greenways, sidewalks, bike lanes, equistrian trails, and mountain bike trails.
title: Carolina Thread Trail

description:
US Census Bureau 2020 Block Groups for Mecklenburg County, NC.

Historic data is available at the link below.
title: Census Block Groups - 2020

description:
US Census Bureau 2020 Blocks for Mecklenburg County, NC.

Historic data is available at the link below.
title: Census Blocks - 2020

description:
US Census Bureau 2020 Census Tracts for Mecklenburg County, NC.

Historic data is available at the link below.
title: Census Tracts - 2020

description:
Priority community census tracts for master planning purposes. US Census Bureau Census Tracts for Mecklenburg County, NC.

Historic data is available at the link below.
title: Priority Communities Census Data

description: The Centers and Corridors development framework was originally introduced in 1994 and is the City of Charlotte's adopted policy for organizing and guiding growth and development within the City of Charlotte. The framework was updated and adopted by the Charlotte City Council in August 2010. The updated framework broadens the original transportation oriented focus to include other aspects of planning and development, such as public facility needs and environmental concerns. The update also provides more specific definitions and guidance for Centers and Corridors and expands the concept to provide recommendations for Wedges, as well.
title: Center Corridor Wedge

description: Historical GIS data for Mecklenburg County from 1999.
title: Historic DELD (Demographic, Employment & Land Development) Data 1999

description: This dataset contains service areas for parks, greenway entrances, and YMCA in Mecklenburg County. Service areas are provided in 5-minute and 10-minute drive times, and 10-minute walking time.
title: Park, Greenway, and YMCA Service Areas

description: This dataset contains addressed greenway entrances along all developed greenways in Mecklenburg County.
title: Greenway Trail Entrances

description: This dataset contains mile markers along active greenways at an interval distance of 0.25 mile in Mecklenburg County. All mile markers begin at the most downstream section of greenway currently developed and progress upstream.
title: Greenway Mile Markers

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation currently developed greenway trails.
title: Greenway Trails

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation Greenway Master Plan. Dataset depicts potential future greenway development in Mecklenburg County.
title: Greenway Master Plan Trail

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation trail maps for all developed greenways.
title: Greenway Trail Maps

description: The dataset consists of various miscellaneous lines necessary to tax information, but not belonging to any other dataset, including old parcel lines (history lines), undedicated access (private roads), proposed roads, parcel lines crossing into other counties, condominium outlines, etc.
title: Miscellaneous Parcel Lines

description: Unrecorded maps, documents and surveys associated with land in Mecklenburg County for research purposes.
title: Historic Book Folders

description: Parcel lines for preliminary plans, from digital submittals of subdivisions by surveying companies.
title: Preliminary Plans

description: This dataset displays the City of Charlotte sidewalk inventory. The dataset contains features for sections of missing sidewalk. The attributes include the presence of planting strips and approximate sidewalk width.
title: Sidewalk Inventory

description: This dataset contains a set of geodetic control stations maintained by NCGS. Each geodetic control station in this dataset has either a precise Latitide/Longitude used for horizontal control or a precise Orthometric Height used for vertical control, or both. These stations are in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: NC Geodetic Survey Control Stations

description: Property related information, this dataset contains easements compiled from manual cadastral maps in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Tax Easements

description: Historic property related information, this dataset contains tax book boundaries defined by Mecklenburg County Assessor's Office. This dataset is used to select or query all parcels within each tax book in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Tax Book Boundaries

description: Mecklenburg County properties that are exempt from property taxes.
title: Tax Exempt Properties

description:
Mecklenburg County unpaid (foreclosure) tax bill information.

Download the text file to your computer.

Open Microsoft Excel. Select the Data tab. Click from Text. Browse to the text file and select it. Click Import. The Text Import Wizard will begin. Select the Delimiter as Comma. Click Next or Load.
title: Unpaid Tax Bills

description:
Current property related information; Including parcel and lot boundaries and right-of-way lines for publicly owned parcels in Mecklenburg County. This dataset includes parcels owned by Catawba Lands Conservancy, CPCC, City of Charlotte, CMS, Mecklenburg County, State of NC, and towns in Mecklenburg County (Cornelius, Davidson, Huntersville, Matthews, Mint Hill, and Pineville).

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Public Owned Parcels

description:
Parcels that have more than one property owner. Current property ownership related information; including ownership name, mailing address, situs address and 2024 real estate assessed values.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Parcels - More Than One Owner

description:
This data represents our most current Real Estate Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal (CAMA) data appended to updated parcels and contains 2024 real estate assessed values, owner, and building information. Be aware of multiple buildings per parcel; like apartment complexes.

Historical data is available at the link below.

Please use Tax Parcel Ownership Data for deriving property value summaries.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW ASSESSORS DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Tax Parcel CAMA Data

description:
DISCLAIMER:

Use this data for deriving property value summaries, or generating mailing notifications. This dataset contains property owner information, most recent deed sales price, 2023 real estate assessed values, and building information.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW ASSESSORS DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Tax Parcel Ownership Data

description: Current tax parcel boundaries ONLY, no CAMA related data appended in this file.
title: Tax Parcel Boundaries

description: Parcel dimensions as annotation points. This file includes legal lot numbers, condo unit numbers, legal block, town house numbers, and parcel dimension numbers.
title: Tax Parcel Annotation

description: Parcel dimensions as annotation along a line. This file includes parcel dimensions.
title: Tax Parcel Dimension

description:
This data contains all parcel sales by sale date with sale amount and grantor/grantee.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW ASSESSORS DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Tax Parcel Sales

description:
This dataset has all parcels in Mecklenburg County that are identified as common area.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW ASSESSORS DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Common Area Parcels

description: Dataset contains public and private colleges and universities in Mecklenburg County.
title: Colleges and Universities

description: This file shows the current administrative still alarm areas for each individual Charlotte Fire Station.
title: Charlotte Fire Response Areas

description: Geographical representation of the physical locations of the Charlotte Fire Department Fire Stations. This dataset represents all active fire stations (or firehouses) that provide fire services to residents in the City of Charlotte. All Charlotte Fire Stations (or firehouses) are staffed 24/7/365 with a minimum of 4 firefighter/EMT's.
title: Charlotte Fire Stations

description: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department (CMPD) Stations.
title: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Offices

description: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department (CMPD) Wrecker Zones. There is a wrecker service assigned to each Police Patrol Division.
title: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Divisions & Wrecker Zones

description: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department(CMPD) Response Areas, also known as CMPD Police Beats, are designed to strengthen ownership and accountability? for crime reduction and community safety. They enable assigned officers to become more familiar with the people who live and work there, patterns of crime and suspect behaviors, and community resources that may be leveraged to address crime and quality of life issues.
title: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Response Areas

description: Mecklenburg County Sheriff Execution Zones.
title: Mecklenburg Sheriff Execution Zones

description: Mecklenburg County Sheriff Operation Zones.
title: Mecklenburg Sheriff Operation Zones

description: Quality of Life Explorer, neighborhood profile areas.
title: Neighborhood Profile Areas

description: The dataset contains volunteer fire districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Volunteer Fire Department Boundaries

description: he dataset contains volunteer fire stations for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Volunteer Fire Department Stations

description: Engineering Map Index - An index showing the engineering mapping tiles for Mecklenburg County.
title: Engineering Grid

description: Streams in Mecklenburg County.
title: Creeks and Streams

description: This dataset shows the protected watersheds indicating that special development restrictions apply within these selected drinking water watershed areas. These watershed boundaries are located in northeastern Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Drinking Water Watersheds

description: This dataset shows the stormwater watersheds, these watersheds identify a creek or stream that stormwater will flow into after a percipitation event. These watershed boundaries are located in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Storm Water Watersheds (Creek Basins)

description: The dataset displays waterbodies along the Catawba River Basin from Lake Hickory thru Lake Norman, Mountain Island Lake, and Lake Wylie to Fishing Creek Lake at Great Falls, SC. This dataset also includes Pond water features within Mecklenburg County, NC. The dataset was created to provide users a coverage for display of the Catawba River as a shaded polygon on maps.
title: Lakes and Ponds

description: Plan review ensures that sufficient post-construction structural controls will be implemented to protect water quality and mitigate the impacts of development on stream flows after construction is complete. Dataset contains construction buffers identified for each creek or stream.
title: Post Construction Districts

description: MPL Sites are compiled to represent the locations of properties that have been designated by the State of North Carolina and Mecklenburg County as environmental contamination sites. Mecklenburg County Priority Contamination Sites (MPL's), may be a single parcel or a collection of two or more contiguous parcels that represent the boundaries of a property that has been designated as a contamination site. These can include; gas stations, cleaners, manufacturing facilities, inert debris facilities, etc.
title: MPL Contamination Sites

description:
Subdivisions can not be perceived as neighborhood boundaries. Neighborhood boundaries are typically subjective.

This file represents a continually expanding dataset for subdivisions in Mecklenburg County. This data is sourced from Recorded maps/plats at the Register of Deeds, names and boundaries are taken from these maps. This data is county-wide EXCEPT for the neighborhoods around Charlotte's Uptown (Dilworth, Elizabeth, etc.) Newer infill developments in these areas may be included. Names and unit counts for apartment and condo complexes, which don't have recorded maps, are taken from Assessment data.
title: Subdivisions

description: This data set is a digital soil survey and is the most detailed level of soil geographic data developed by the National Cooperative Soil Survey. The information was collected by digitizing maps, by compiling information onto a planimetric correct base and digitizing, or by revising digitized maps using remotely sensed and other information.
title: Soils

description: The dataset contains polygons representing: Piped - No Buffer; Post Construction Buffers; Surface Water Infrastructure Management (SWIM) buffers; Water Supply Watershed Buffers (WSW); and Wildlife Buffers for Mecklenburg County,  NC.
title: Water Quality Buffers

description: This dataset was generated to publish a geospatial inventory of YMCAs in  Mecklenburg County, NC. This data serves to support and assist the Charlotte Mecklenburg Planning Department, The City of Charlotte, and others in Urban Planning decisions.
title: YMCA

description: This data set represents the extent, approximate location and type of wetlands and deepwater habitats in North Carolina and South Carolina. These data delineate the areal extent of wetlands and surface waters as defined by Cowardin et al. (1979). The National Wetlands Inventory - Version 2, Surface Waters and Wetlands Inventory was derived by retaining the wetland and deepwater polygons that compose the NWI digital wetlands spatial data layer and reintroducing any linear wetland or surface water features that were orphaned from the original NWI hard copy maps by converting them to narrow polygonal features.
source: US Fish and Wildlife Service: National Wetlands Inventory
title: Wetlands

description: An area of the floodplain that must be kept clear of any obstruction (fill dirt, buildings, etc) as to not impede the flow of water. Development in this area is very restrictive, and usually requires a detailed engineering analysis (and local approval) prior to beginning development.
title: Community Floodway

description: Federal Emergency Management Agency one hundred year floodplain for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: FEMA Floodplain

description: Dataset contains polygons that represent the FEMA Floodway. The floodway is an area that must be reserved in order to discharge of the 100 year flood without cumulatively increasing the water surface elevation more than 0.5 feet. No fill or construction is permitted in this area.
title: FEMA Floodway

description: Future floodplains are also called Community Floodplains and show where flooding is likely to occur in the future based on expected development upstream. As development occurs, regulations that help protect FEMA Floodplains and Community Floodplains will avoid hundreds of millions of dollars in future flood damage. Landowners and professionals planning any development activity in a floodplain within the City of Charlotte and/or Mecklenburg County should have the knowledge and skills to plan, design, and construct their project in compliance with local, state and federal Floodplain Regulations. For purposes of floodplain management, development means any man-made change to improved and unimproved real estate, including, but not limited to, buildings or other structures, mining, dredging, filling, grading, paving, excavating or drilling operations. Floodplain development restrictions apply to both FEMA Floodplains and Community Floodplains.
title: Community Floodplain

description: A line on a floodplain map indicating the discharges and water surface elevations that have been calculated for that section of the stream and floodplain.
title: Floodplain Cross Sections

description: Floodplain engineering models
title: Flood Mitigation Engineering Models, etc.

description: Effective and Preliminary Floodplain data, CAD, FIS, LOMC, and Flood Insurance Rate Map Panels: PDF versions of the official map on which the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) has delineated the Special Flood Hazard Areas and Community Floodplain for communities within Mecklenburg County. The main use of the FIRM is to correctly rate flood insurance policies but it also provides valuable information concerning the flood risk of property.
title: Floodplain Mapping

description: Health department restaurant inspection data for Mecklenburg County
title: Health Department Healthy LIVES (Local Inspector Value-Entry Specification) feed data

description: Churches dataset defines locations classified as religious organizations or places of worship in Mecklenburg County.This dataset is queried from the Master Address Table. There aren't any organization names or contact information within this dataset.
title: Churches

description: Seven of Charlotte's most significant older neighborhoods have been designated by City Council as Local Historic Districts, in recognition of their importance in the history and character of the city. The Historic District Commission and its staff work with property owners and businesses in the districts to assure that development and renovation occurs in a manner that is consistent with the character of the neighborhood. The purpose of a local historic district is to encourage the restoration, preservation, rehabilitation, and conservation of historically significant areas, structures, buildings, sites, and objects and their surroundings from potentially adverse influences which may cause the decline, decay, or total destruction of important historical, architectural, and archaeological features, which are a part of the city’s heritage, and to review new construction design to ensure compatibility with the character of the district.
title: Historic Districts

description: Historic and abandoned cemeteries in Mecklenburg County, NC. The dataset was developed to alert existing and potential property owners of the existence of these cemeteries.
title: Historic Cemeteries

description: This dataset represents a geospatial inventory of Historic Properties in Mecklenburg County.
title: Historic Property Local

description: This dataset represents nationally-designated historic properties in Mecklenburg County.
title: Historic Property National

description: Historical planimetric files by year for Mecklenburg County, NC.
title: Historic Planimetrics

description: This dataset was generated to publish a geospatial inventory of Medical Facilities in Mecklenburg County. This data serves to support and assist the Charlotte Mecklenburg Planning Department, The City of Charlotte, and others in Urban Planning decisions.
title: Medical Facilities

description:
Polygon data for single family impervious surfaces in Charlotte-Mecklenburg, North Carolina.

Historical data is available at the link below.
title: Residential Impervious Surfaces

description:
This dataset contains polygons representing the footprints of impervious area for commercial parcels; parking lots, buildings, etc, within Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. It is used to issue storm water bills to multifamily and commercial customers.

Historical data is available at the link below.
title: Commercial Impervious Surfaces

description:
This dataset contains polygons representing the footprints of impervious areas that are classified as edge of streets and edge of sidewalks within Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.

Historical data is available at the link below.
title: Impervious - Edge of Pavement

description: A point coverage of the Public Libraries in City of Charlotte and Mecklenburg County library system.
title: Libraries

description: The Master Address Table contains all known addresses within Mecklenburg County. Addresses for each property are situs (physical) address. Addresses can be sorted by use or type, i.e.; Commercial, Single Family, Industrial, etc.
title: Master Address

description: This dataset contains polygon features representing areas of additional taxation for growth and development in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Municipal Service Districts

description: The Charlotte to Mooresville Trail is a county network of planned greenways and sidewalks that connect the City of Charlotte to the City of Mooresville in Iredell County. This shapefile shows the location of planned routes. Charlotte to Mooresville Trail routes can include natural surface trails, paved greenways, sidewalks, and bike lanes.
title: Charlotte to Mooresville Trail

description: City of Charlotte Cross Charlotte Trail. This dataset shows the existing and proposed alignments of the Cross Charlotte Trail. It also identifies which agency is responsible for construction and maintenance of each section of the trail.
title: Cross Charlotte Trail

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation community gap areas identifies areas of Mecklenburg County where property acquisition or partnerships are needed to increase recreation access and recreation opportunities for residents.
title: Greenprint Community Gap Areas

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation easements, parcels where Park and Recreation is granted use of property, but does not own the parcels.
title: Park Easements

description:
Property related information for parcels owned by Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW PARK PARCEL DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Park Parcels

description: Mecklenburg County owned property designated for park and/or greenway use. This is a dissolved file of Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation Park Parcels, to create a boundary file for each park.
title: Park Property

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation districts.
title: Park Regions

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation park location entrance points.
title: Park Locations

description:
Amenities are classified as recreation components within a park or along a greenway; tennis courts, playgrounds, walking paths, etc.

 Park amenities for all Park and Recreation parks in Mecklenburg County, including Charlotte, Davidson, Cornelius, Davidson, Huntersville, Matthews, Mint Hill, and Pineville.
title: Park Amenity

description:
Features are classified as items, such as; trash cans, water fountains, benches, bollards, art, memorials, etc.

 Park features for all Park and Recreation parks and greenways in Mecklenburg County, including Charlotte, Davidson, Cornelius, Davidson, Huntersville, Matthews, Mint Hill, and Pineville.
title: Park Features

description: Park advisory council district boundaries for Mecklenburg County.
title: Park Advisory Council Districts

description: Mecklenburg County Park and Recreation nature preserve trails.
title: Nature Preserve Trails

description: Public and private golf courses in Mecklenburg County, identified by parcels.
title: Golf Courses

description: Post Office locations in Mecklenburg County, NC.
title: Post Offices

description: This dataset illustrates the seven City Council Districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. The City Council Districts are geographical areas in the City of Charlotte that serve as areas of interest for the elected members of Charlotte City Council. Each geographical area has a council member elected on the behalf of the citizens of that area.
title: Charlotte City Council Districts

description: When Charlotte received its colonial charter from Governor William Tryon in 1768, part of the charter he issued required that a town plan be surveyed and adopted. Trade and Tryon streets were laid out as the main streets along existing roads that crossed here, and a grid emanating out from where they met was established as the street and block system for the city.
title: Charlotte Uptown Wards

description: This dataset shows the political jurisdictions for each city and town in Mecklenburg County.
title: Mecklenburg County Jurisdictions

description: The County boundary of Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Mecklenburg County Boundary

description: The County boundaries for all Counties in North and South Carolina.
title: North Carolina/South Carolina County Boundaries

description: This dataset contains the CURRENT State House Districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A state house district is an area bound by a physical feature, voting precinct or a census boundary that is determined by the State of North Carolina.
title: NC House of Representatives District-Current

description: This dataset contains the HISTORICAL State House Districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A state house district is an area bound by a physical feature, voting precinct or a census boundary that is determined by the State of North Carolina.
title: NC House of Representatives Districts-Historical

description: This dataset contains the CURRENT State Senate Districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A state senate district is an area bound by a physical feature, voting precinct or a census boundary that is determined by the State of North Carolina.
title: NC Senate District-Current

description: This dataset contains the HISTORICAL State Senate Districts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A state senate district is an area bound by a physical feature, voting precinct or a census boundary that is determined by the State of North Carolina.
title: NC Senate Districts-Historical

description: This dataset shows total County area controlled by each City and Town in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. This dataset includes Jurisdictions for each City/Town and the unincorporated area.
title: Sphere of Influence

description: This dataset shows the Superior Court Districts within Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Superior Court Districts

description: The dataset represents the CURRENT United States Congressional Districts within Mecklenburg County. The U.S. Congressional Districts are geographical areas used for administrative purposes in the election of North Carolina Representatives to the US Congress.
title: US Congress District-Current

description: The dataset represents the HISTORICAL United States Congressional Districts within Mecklenburg County. The U.S. Congressional Districts are geographical areas used for administrative purposes in the election of North Carolina Representatives to the US Congress.
title: US Congress Districts-Historical

description: This dataset contains the polling locations for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A polling location is a place where voting occurs during election events. Ideally, less than 3500 registered voters will be assigned to a polling location within a precinct.
title: Voter Polling Locations

description: This dataset contains the Voting Precincts for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. A voting precinct is an area bound by a physical feature or a census boundary. Persons within a precinct are assigned to a polling location based on precinct.
title: Voting Precincts

description: This dataset contains polygons representing zip code areas in Mecklenburg County, NC.
title: Zip Codes

description: Dataset contains points representing Elementary, Middle, and High Schools in Mecklenburg County.
title: CMS Public Schools

description: Dataset contains district boundaries representing Charlotte-Mecklenburg School Board in Mecklenburg County.
title: CMS School Board Districts

description: Dataset contains points representing current Charter schools in Mecklenburg County.
title: Charter Schools in Mecklenburg County

description: Dataset contains Private Schools (Elementary, Middle, High, Religious, Specialty) in Mecklenburg County licensed by the State of North Carolina.
title: Private Schools in Mecklenburg County

description:
Charlotte-Mecklenburg Elementary School Boundaries for 2024-2025

Historical data is available at the link below.

Charlotte-Mecklenburg Middle School Boundaries for 2024-2025

Charlotte-Mecklenburg High School Boundaries for 2024-2025

description: This data represents areas that are classified as open space and located along the Urban Arboretum Trail.
title: City Open Space

description: This data represents the route that the Urban Arboretum Trail follows along the City of Charlotte's Third Ward.
title: Urban Arboretum Trail Route

description: This dataset contains Park and Ride Lots for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) in Mecklenburg County and neighboring communities.
title: CATS Park and Ride Lots

description: This dataset contains Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) Bus Stops for Mecklenburg County and neighboring communities. Ridership and frequency are weekday only and are calculated following each service change after the first full month. Bus stop locations are updated in real time. These data are a snapshot based on when the Housing Locational Tool is updated.
title: CATS Bus Stops

description: This dataset contains Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) Routes for Mecklenburg County and neighboring communities.
title: CATS Bus Routes

description: This dataset contains current Lynx Blueline stations for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Blueline Stations

description: This dataset contains current Lynx Blueline track alignment from UNC Charlotte to I-485 in South Charlotte, for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Blueline Track

description: This dataset contains proposed Lynx Redline stations for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) commuter rail in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Redline Stations

description: This dataset contains the proposed Lynx Redline track alignment for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) commuter rail in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Redline Track

description: This dataset contains proposed Lynx Silverline stations for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) from Union County, NC to Gaston County, NC.
title: CATS Lynx Silverline Stations

description: This dataset contains proposed Lynx Silverline track alignment for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) from Union County, NC to Gaston County, NC.
title: CATS Lynx Silverline Track

description: This dataset contains Lynx Goldline stations for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Goldline Stations

description: This dataset contains Lynx Goldline track alignment for Charlotte Area Transit System (CATS) in Mecklenburg County.
title: CATS Lynx Goldline Track

description: Used to identify city and state maintained streets within the City of Charlotte. Annually, the State Street-Aid Program (Powell Bill) allocates monies to incorporated municipalities who maintains their own streets (GS 136-41.1 thru 136-41.3). Funding for this program comes from a 1-3/4 cent tax per gallon of motor fuel. The amount distributed to each municipality is a factor of population and mileage of publicly maintained streets. Allocations are usually disbursed on or before October 1. Powell Bill funds shall be expended only for the purposes of maintaining, repairing, constructing, reconstructing or widening of local streets that are the responsibility of the municipality.
title: Street Maintenance Responsibility

description: An easement is a right of use by one party over the property of another party, sometimes for a specific purpose. For Storm Water, easements are property interests which document the conditions under which Storm Water has permission to enter an easement area on private property to repair drainage issues and/or perform on-going maintenance. A storm drainage easement is a recorded, legal document which describes easement boundaries and any conditions and restrictions related to the permission granted by the property owner to Storm Water. Under the easement, the property owner is the grantor and the City (or other applicable municipality through Charlotte-Mecklenburg Storm Water) is the grantee. This represents a location where there is a Storm Water Services Easement. This may not be inclusive of all easements. Please consult Land Records to perform research.
title: Storm Water Easements

description: Storm structures within the City of Charlotte limits
title: Storm Water Structures

description: Represent open storm drainage systems including creeks, channels, roadside ditches within the city of Charlotte limits
title: Storm Water Channels

description: Represent storm pipes within the City of Charlotte limits
title: Storm Water Pipes

description: Data layer is a depiction of each intersection in Mecklenburg County. As each street intersects there is an intersection point.
title: Street Intersections

description: Dataset contains developed interstate highway polylines within Mecklenburg County.
title: Interstates

description: Dataset contains developed interstate highway polylines within counties adjacent to and surrounding Mecklenburg County.
title: Interstates outside Mecklenburg County

description: Dataset contains developed NC and US highway polylines within Mecklenburg County.
title: NC/US Highways

description: Dataset contains developed NC and US highway polylines within counties adjecent to and surrounding Mecklenburg County.
title: NC/US Highways outside Mecklenburg County

description: This dataset contains Parking Meters for Uptown Charlotte, Elizabeth Neighborhood, and South End in Mecklenburg County.
title: Parking Meters

description: This dataset contains Speed Humps for City of Charlotte. Point locations of road hump traffic calming devices to show the location of speed humps for inventory and maintenance analysis in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Speed Humps

description: This dataset contains the street centerlines for all streets, major roads and highways for Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Street Centerline

description: This dataset contains the street centerlines for all major roads in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Thoroughfare

description: Transportation Analysis Zones for the eleven County metrolina region.
title: Transportation Analysis Zones

description: The dataset contains the railroad right-of-ways for the county digitized from data compiled from county manual tax maps onto planimetric maps. The name of the railroad company owning the right-of-way is part of the dataset.
title: Railroad Right-Of-Way

description: This dataset contains all the rail lines in the county and is based on the county's street centerline file. The county in description is Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
title: Railroads

description: The dataset contains the utility right-of-ways in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. Data is digitized from  manual tax maps and planimetric maps. The name of the utility company owning the right-of-way is part of the dataset.
title: Utility Right-of-Ways

description: This dataset shows zoning designations for the City of Charlotte and its planning area in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. The PDF document contains zoning descriptions.
title: City of Charlotte Zoning

description: This dataset shows zoning designations for the Towns of Cornelius, Davidson, Huntersville, Matthews, Mint Hill, and Pineville in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina excluding the city of Charlotte and its planning area. The PDF document contains zoning descriptions.
title: Unincorporated County & Towns Zoning

description:
This dataset contains all parcels in Mecklenburg County with zoning designation, municipality, and zipcode attached. The PDF document contains zoning descriptions.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW THIS DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Parcels with zoning and zipcode

description:
Parcel land use provides a parcel-level digital representation of the existing land use for all parcels.

Parcels with a conservation and/or farming land use code are queried as a subset annually.

Historical data is available at the link below.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Tax Parcel Landuse Existing

description: Mortgage information from Mecklenburg County Tax Assessors Office.
title: Tax Assessor Mortgage Data

description: Community planning areas are 15 boundaries for the City of Charlotte planning jurisdiction.
title: Community Planning Areas

description: Dataset provides NC DHHS licensed daycare locations in Mecklenburg County.
title: Daycare

description: Dataset provides locations for Mecklenburg County operated solid waste facilities. Locations are self-service or staffed.
title: Solid Waste Facility

description: Dataset displays solid waste collection zones for the City of Charlotte.
title: Solid Waste Collection Zones

description: Dataset provides locations for Landfills (open and closed) in Mecklenburg County.
title: Landfills

description: The AADT shapefile is a station point shapefile of Annual Average Daily Traffic (AADT) estimates. This data includes the data submitted to FHWA for Highway Performance Monitoring System (HPMS) AADT data. Data is reported for AADT on all highways with a Functional Classification (FC) above Local. Data in the file includes all of Mecklenburg County.
title: NCDOT Traffic Estimates

description: The neighborhood character, economics, education, engagement, environment, health, housing, safety and transportation data used by the Quality of Life Explorer.
title: Quality of Life

description: This dataset contains baskets associated with all, currently active, disc golf courses in Mecklenburg County.
title: Disc Golf Course Baskets

description: This dataset contains tees associated with all, currently active, disc golf courses in Mecklenburg County.
title: Disc Golf Course Tees

description: This dataset contains fairways associated with all, currently active, disc golf courses in Mecklenburg County.
title: Disc Golf Course Fairway

description:
This dataset contains walking paths, sidewalks, natural surface trails, hiking trails, and mountain biking trails inside all Park and Recreation parks within Mecklenburg County.

 This dataset does not include nature preserve trails, greenways, City of Charlotte or Town sidewalks.
title: Park Trails

description:
This dataset contains parcels in Mecklenburg County that are identified as undeveloped land or vacant land. Meaning land that does not currently have a commercial or residential structure built upon it.

FOR NON-GIS SOFTWARE USERS WHO WANT TO VIEW DATA IN EXCEL: Unzip File to local hard drive folder, Launch Excel, Click the File tab and select Open. Click the Files of Type drop-down list; by default it reads, All Excel Files. Select dBase Files or All Files. Use the file browser to locate the dBase(*.dbf) format file you want to open. Lastly, Save the loaded dbf file as an Excel Workbook.
title: Vacant Parcels
